column4: it seems to me that Ubuntu LiveCD has problem to start on SATA or High capacity HD, it is finding problems to work with the drives, anybody knows something about it?
any recommendation? I don't want to install Win 7 or any other Win version, has anybody experienced something similar?
I can't install Lucid on a brand new pc
here's how a help channel works: you supply us with as much information as possible, and then we try to figure out what's causing your problem. currently, we're stuck at step 1...
can you boot from the live cd, without trying the installer?
process stops before showing any installation interfase at all
might be worth verifying the cd image
might you have another machine to test it on?
if you mean to checksum the ISO file, I did it
no, i meant verify that the disk itself was burned correctly
I installed Ubuntu 10.04 on another machine already with the same CD
I thought that it could be dued to 32-bit Lucid LiveCD I was using first, so I downloaded 64-bit version, but i didn't work neither
interesting. and you say it won't even boot? any other errors logged to the console?
a lot of error and logs, all related to drives
do you have another operating system running on the machine?
might simply be that the disk is going

I saw people messages on the Web about this installation problem, or at least with the same error message "Unexpected exit with status 0x0009", one of the them was related to ACPI issues on a laptop and stuff like that
